questions.scene-info: You have received a text message from DPD delivery regarding a delivery attempt. Is this a phishing attempt?

scenario.title: Atempted delivery Of your package
scenario.content: we attempted to deliver your package however there was nobody avialable to receive it. To arrange a redelivery please click the link bleow http:/delivery-dpd.coom/re-schedule

scenario.title: Set up e-payslips for your account
scenario.content:
We started getting all employees to change to e-payslips from paper paylsips.
 To set up your account please click this link below 
http:/payroll-setupp-free.com/setup

questions.explanation: This is a phishing email as show in a few ways. The sender is not specifically from a company domain instead it is from a generic google gmail account domain which is common by attackers to seem more legitimate. The link provided is also not legitimate as it does not link to a real platform instead it is trying to mimic one with payrolls and setup used in the link is trying to make it more legitimate.

scenario.content: Your number has won Â£10000 pounds! IN the weekly draw. send your name, address, account detail to this number to claim. +1 0522567898

questions.explanation: This is a phishing attempt as it claims that the person recieving this message has won a large sum of money even though they havent entered any competition. The message contains some spelling and gramamatical errors and comes from an unkown sender which is a very common indication of scam messages. It also requests personal information though SMS which is not a legitimate method to claim prizes, especially this high.

scenario.title: Critical Security Alert
scenario.content:
Sign in attempt blocked
john.smith@gmail.com
Somebody used your password to try to sign in to your account from an unusual location. we have taken steps to secure your account. Sign back into your account and reset your password from the link below 
https://google-security.co/reset

questions.explanation: This email scenario here represents a medium difficulty in recognising that it is phishing as it is very close to google's security alert emails. However there are some red flags which are presented if you look closer. The sender domain and the link dont match what google's actual domain is and the links also doesnt match with google's official domains. The message has very urgent language used by requesting immediate action by accessing the account through the link given.

questions.scene-info: Make sure you check your links and

scenario.content:
Thank you for using Support.To Continue with your activation please click here:
https://support.microsoft.com/en-us

questions.explanation: This is not phishing as it is an actual microsoft support message. The link provided is a legitimate microsoft link to their main support page.
